column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////After starting off with drinks from the well-stocked bar (including an incredibly rich cognac sazerac - highly recommended)
column2: we started off with the larger of the seafood platters. The expectations were not high in a landlocked state in the dead of winter
column3: but everything was pretty damn good - the salmon ceviche and west coast oysters were standouts. It was definitely a generous amount of seafood
column4: but we plowed ahead and shared a few dishes afterwards
column5: including the delicious and incredibly reasonably-priced burger ($9.95)
column7: and the rich foie gras terrine (accompanied by a heavenly sweet blackberry jam).
